image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The court heard the 28-year-old travelled straight from a jail in Sydney to assault his ex-partner, in breach of a family violence order.

title.children: Released Long Bay jail inmate who travelled to Canberra to rape ex partner given 10-year sentence

image.altText: A young girl shoots a basketball on an indoor court

props.synopsis: After-school activities can offer physical and mental health benefits, improved resilience and better academic performance, but how can families balance these with the time and financial costs?

title.children: Extracurricular activities provide big benefits to kids – but how much is too much?

image.altText: A schoolboy and an elderly lady smile at the camera side by side.

props.synopsis: Much like ABC TV's award-winning series 'Old People's Home for Teenagers', a weekly initiative at Club Kalina in Canberra is offering students the opportunity to develop social bonds while contributing in a meaningful way to their local community — and it's been a resounding success.

title.children: How school kid Mason became friends with Helen, who lives with dementia

image.altText: Fears Tasmania left exposed after AFP officers removed from Hobart's airport

props.synopsis: AFP officers have walked off the job at seven major airports around the country as part of ongoing industrial action.

title.children: AFP officers walked off the job from seven major airports, but didn't make their action public due to security concerns

image.altText: A grass strip next to a road with multiple bouquets of flowers and a wooden cross.

props.synopsis: The ACT Children's Court heard the 15-year-old boy accused of driving a stolen car that crashed and fatally injured another teenager near State Circle in April has allegedly been on a crime spree in the four months since.

title.children: Canberra teenager who allegedly drove stolen car involved in fatal crash denied bail

image.altText: A woman with shoulder length blonde hair in an orange sweater holds a mug that reads "straight outta Tuggers".

props.synopsis: Growth in Canberra has shifted to the north and west in recent years, and the Tuggeranong area is not predicted to expand. So what can residents who've already made this southern suburb their home expect?

title.children: This area is set to have zero per cent population growth. What does that mean for its residents?

image.altText: CFMEU MEMBERS RALLY BRISBANE

props.synopsis: Affiliation and donations to the ALP have been suspended, administrators forced in, and now Labor is using the bad stench around the CFMEU as a political weapon against the Greens.

title.children: A Greens MP's CFMEU antics call up memories of Tony Abbott standing in front of 'Ditch the Witch' placards

image.altText: Richard Marles National Press Club speech

props.synopsis: The defence minister requested a second office be opened for ministerial duties, just a three-minute walk from his electorate office.

title.children: Defence Minister Richard Marles opened $600k second office despite already having one three minutes away

props.synopsis: Kidnapped from his Burkina Faso home at gunpoint in 2016, Ken Elliott survived seven years in the desert as a prisoner of Al Qaeda.

title.children: Australian doctor who survived seven years in the desert as a prisoner of Al Qaeda speaks for the first time

image.altText: A composite image of Brittany Higgins and Linda Reynolds.

props.synopsis: Linda Reynolds's lawyer casts doubt on medical reports that claim Brittany Higgins is unfit to give evidence in the high-stakes defamation trial underway in Perth.

title.children: Medical reports failed to excuse Brittany Higgins from giving evidence, defamation trial told

image.altText: A man's legs, wearing a military uniform and boots, standing on a flag on the ground.

props.synopsis: A former Wagner Group mercenary sheds light on the organisation's inner workings, as well as its training and recruitment procedures as the private army announces it has pulled out of Ukraine.

title.children: Former Wagner soldier details horrors of Putin's 'meat grinder' as group pulls out of Ukraine

image.altText: Madison de Rozario and Brenden Hall march with the Australian flag

props.synopsis: Paris comes alive once more, as the 17th Paralympic Games are set to open with the Opening Ceremony at the Place de la Concorde and along the Champs-Elysées.

title.children: Paralympics opening ceremony a wave of colour in Paris as Australians add to Champs-Elysées party — as it happened

image.altText: Illuminated light bulb strands

props.synopsis: Australia's power market operator says the outlook has improved for the country's biggest grid, but the risks of delays to new projects loom large.

title.children: Immediate threat of summer blackouts eases but market operator warns risks remain

image.altText: A soldier holding a big gun runs across a sandy road in front of an armoured vehicle.

props.synopsis: At least nine Palestinians have been killed in Israeli raids and strikes on several towns in the north of the occupied West Bank, according to a Red Crescent spokesperson.

title.children: Nine Palestinians killed in Israeli raids and strikes on West Bank, humanitarian workers say

image.altText: A pair of pink ski on a grassy hill, snow-covered mountains in the background

props.synopsis: The recent hot spell may feel unfamiliar, but weather extremes are quickly becoming the norm, as climate change up-ends the winter seasons.

title.children: As Australia basks in sunshine, ski fields turn to sludge in heatwave labelled a 'hot mess' by climate scientists

image.altText: A graduate holds on to his hat while talking on his mobile phone

props.synopsis: The federal government's proposal to cap international student enrolments has prompted dire warnings from parts of the sector about the economic fallout.

title.children: Universities warn international student cap could slash numbers further than intended

image.altText: A long tube of ice with a measuring tape

props.synopsis: The permafrost is melting and scientists are racing to collect ancient viruses trapped in the ice to understand how they’ve adapted to shifting climate over millennia.

title.children: Scientists discover 1,700 new  'zombie' viruses in ancient permafrost in the Himalayas

image.altText: A person on a phone with an online banking card on the main screen

props.synopsis: Neobanks are online-only branches, and experts are concerned they could be more susceptible to scammers.

title.children: Digital banks are 'a gift' for scammers. Here's what you need to know to keep your savings safe

image.altText: Wieambilla hideout

props.synopsis: A marathon five-week inquest into the devastating Wieambilla shootings, which claimed the lives of two young police officers and an innocent neighbour, has reached its final day.

title.children: Paranoia, hideouts and 'the Rubicon': What we've learned from the Wieambilla shooting inquest

image.altText: A man holding a pipe connected to sewage truck.

props.synopsis: More than 700 homes in eight new housing estates are having their sewage transported by road to Adelaide's main wastewater treatment plant, reflecting a national underinvestment in infrastructure.

title.children: 'It's unbearable': Sewage trucked daily from housing estates in Adelaide's north will continue for years

image.altText: Hughenden caravan park

props.synopsis: A family of five was inside the caravan when it was stolen and managed to escape. An 18-year-old man has been charged following the incident and will face court today.

title.children: Man arrested after bizarre theft of caravan with family inside at outback holiday park

props.synopsis: Liberal frontbencher Simon Birmingham has pledged the Coalition would reverse the federal government's "stubborn" refusal to reopen Australia's embassy in Kyiv, following the lead of numerous nations who have returned their diplomats to war-torn Ukraine.

title.children: Coalition pledges to reopen Australia's empty embassy in Ukraine's capital, during visit to Kyiv

image.altText: A man looks up wearing a black hat, glasses and a blue long sleeve shirt.

props.synopsis: The nine-month-old baby was with his family at Hanlon Park around midday on Tuesday, when it's alleged an unknown man approached them and poured hot liquid on the baby.

title.children: Police release new photos in search for man after hot coffee poured on baby at Brisbane park

image.altText: Mount Isa Mines complex

props.synopsis: A game of cat and mouse is being played between the state and Swiss multinational Glencore in an outback town facing the closure of its historic copper mine.

title.children: Closure of Australia's deepest copper mine threatens thousands of Queensland jobs

image.altText: An old silver-haired lady in a floral dress looks at a man in a suit who is holding a medal. They are standing in a grand room.

props.synopsis: Australia will soon be getting a poet laureate. But what does that actually mean? We sit down with the UK laureate, Simon Armitage, to find out.

title.children: Getting paid in sherry and writing a tribute to the queen: What does a poet laureate actually do?

image.altText: A man in a collared shirt and glasses walking down a street, with greenery in the background.

props.synopsis: Simon Quilty is claiming the NT Department of Health owes him thousands of hours in unpaid overtime, accrued while he was working at the Katherine and Alice Springs hospitals.

title.children: Prominent outback doctor sues NT health department over alleged 15,000 hours of unpaid overtime

image.altText: Two people on a red couch with a staffy dog

props.synopsis: A distraught pet owner expresses her relief after her rescue staffy is returned to Sydney, having been spotted in Queensland through the help of a Facebook lost pet group.

title.children: Roo the staffy disappeared from her Sydney backyard. She was found on a Queensland farm almost 1,000 kilometres away

image.altText: Bri Davey smiles while holding a football. She is surrounded by other club captains including Katie Brennan and Meg McDonald

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Lions are favourites to defend last year's premiership, with runners-up North Melbourne also in the mix. Here are all the answers to your burning questions ahead of the opening round.

title.children: The AFLW kicks off on Friday night with a double-header — here's all you need to know about the upcoming season

image.altText: Adam Bandt press club

props.synopsis: Content-wise, the Greens leader unabashedly promoted his movement's progressive ambitions to tax big corporations. But in style, his performance was pure Donald.

title.children: Adam Bandt's press club address was pure Trump, at least as far as style is concerned

image.altText: A woman smiling

props.synopsis: Polls put Kamala Harris slightly ahead of Donald Trump in the US election race. But there are two potential stumbling blocks that could up-end the contest once again.

title.children: Kamala Harris is ahead of Donald Trump, but two big wildcards could up-end the race

image.altText: Bentinck Island fish traps from the air

props.synopsis: Traditional owners say World Heritage listing would help preserve Australia's largest archaeological site, an elaborate network of stone walls designed to trap fish at low tide in the Gulf of Carpentaria.

title.children: Calls to protect northern Australia's ancient stone wall fish traps from tourists, climate change

image.altText: big build photo generic

props.synopsis: Federal Infrastructure Minister Catherine King has been rolled in her efforts to decrease the Commonwealth's share of major transport funding, with Tasmania and WA joining a state and territory pile-on.

title.children: State and territory pressure mounts on Catherine King as transport funding deal risks derailment

image.altText: cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

props.synopsis: The annual rate of inflation declined in July, as commonwealth and state rebates drove energy prices lower, the Bureau of Statistics said.

title.children: Inflation falls to 3.5pc in July as energy rebates help to push electricity prices lower

image.altText: A clear IV drip with cords attached against a white wall.

props.synopsis: Federal Health Minister Mark Butler said the additional bags would ensure there was "more than enough to meet Australian demand over that period".

title.children: Federal government secures 22 million IV fluid bags amid global shortage

image.altText: A man in a hospital bed with tubes going into his nose and mouth.

props.synopsis: Hepatitis C attacked Dennis Maby's liver over two decades and nearly claimed his life. Now clear of the disease he's urging other people to get tested.

title.children: There's now a cure for Hepatitis C. Finding the people who need it is the challenge
